job_title: Counselor in Jersey City, NJ
pros: Great work environment among counselors overall.
cons: No overtime, abusive caseloads. During peak registration, you knew the time you have to be in but not the time you would be done. Sometimes registration finished at 10pm and counselors had to be back the next day at 9:00am. No compensation whatsoever for overtime. This situation re-occurred every year in the months of August-September.

job_title: IT Support Specialist in Jersey City, NJ

cons: Poor infrastructure and financial compensation. You will most likely need a 2nd or 3rd job to meet ends. Buildings are 50+ years old as well as the equipment for staff, such as desks and etc.

job_title: Office Assistant in Jersey City, NJ
pros: If you are a student they will happily work with your schedule and there is an overall friendly atmosphere. Also, if you give them a few month's notice they can give you an amazing amount of vacation days.
cons: Lack of communication between departments for updated policies, at a point you need to be able to fend for yourself without the help of management to handle the hundreds of students that come in for peak registration. So mostly, the flow of how well the workday goes is between yourself and two other office assistants, otherwise supervisors on an occasion will help.

job_title: Instructional Designer in Jersey City, NJ
pros: The faculty and staff are really caring and passionate about their work. We get all of holidays and PTO. Raises every year with excellent benefits. Honestly my insurance covers like everything.
cons: All work is on-campus with no remote work option.

job_title: Instructor in Jersey City, NJ
pros:
Communication between staff and departments  is very good.

cons: HR needs to be more careful when handling employees' records. They lost/misplaced my file when I was onboarding, and I didnt know where it had gone.  They asked me to fill in another form just to complete process. Whew!

review_title: Can you say toxic work environment?
job_title: Director in Jersey City, NJ
pros: There were no pros to Hudson County Community College.
cons: HCCC is a turnover factory that will bring your career in higher education to a grinding halt.  The amount of yelling and bullying at this institution is off the charts.  The senior leadership all dislike or distrust one another, and they expect you to obey every command without thinking (or giving feedback).  Of course to make matters worse, their pay is absolutely horrible, so not only are you in a toxic work environment, but they're not even paying you enough to be tolerable. I would steer clear of this place unless your career is at a complete dead end and you have little to risk. But don't for a second think you can parlay this job into something better because you'll be churned long before that happens.  And to make matters worse, they are experiencing a severe enrollment crisis. The president put out an email saying that things are getting worse and won't be getting better. They then laid off and fired over 30 people. The trend line doesn't look good.

review_title: Working at  HCCC is a wonderful experience.
